main event: A civilian observed a bright light moving across the sky near Kennewick, Washington, on June 1, 1955. The object was described as a large, shining metallic ball which exhibited unusual speed and movement characteristics.
interesting points: The sighting was reported one year after the incident, making immediate investigation impossible., The witness described the object moving at speeds of 2000 to 3000 feet per second., The observer claimed the object emitted a 'white glow' and made a sound similar to a tractor engine., It was noted that the area had established balloon-launching facilities, raising the possibility that the observed object could have been a balloon., The sighting raised security concerns, speculating on possibilities of advanced technology or foreign origins.
witness description: Sgt. Gordon Richardson, a police officer in Kennewick, Washington.
